reviewText: I feel obliged to begin by saying: O.K.  I realize that there are plenty who will pass this movie with good reason: a gay man seduces his sister (!); a drugee remains lucid and sensitive to her brother's philosophical pleadings (!); a man dying of brain cancer remains sufficiently in control to be a top (!); as I said, O.K.  Nevertheless, the acting, the directing, the cinematography make this incredible story somehow touching; yes, I said it, touching.  So maybe it is European--but, yes but, there is something worth hearing here: caring is important even if the story is not exactly cinema verite.
